lines.value: All the contagion of the south light on you,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: You shames of Rome! you herd of--Boils and plagues
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Plaster you o'er, that you may be abhorr'd
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Further than seen and one infect another
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Against the wind a mile! You souls of geese,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: That bear the shapes of men, how have you run
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: From slaves that apes would beat! Pluto and hell!
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: All hurt behind; backs red, and faces pale
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: With flight and agued fear! Mend and charge home,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Or, by the fires of heaven, I'll leave the foe
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: And make my wars on you: look to't: come on;
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: If you'll stand fast, we'll beat them to their wives,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: As they us to our trenches followed.
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: So, now the gates are ope: now prove good seconds:
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: 'Tis for the followers fortune widens them,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Not for the fliers: mark me, and do the like.
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: First Soldier
lines.speaker: First Soldier

lines.value: Fool-hardiness; not I.
lines.speaker: First Soldier

lines.value: Second Soldier
lines.speaker: Second Soldier

lines.value: Nor I.
lines.speaker: Second Soldier

lines.value: First Soldier
lines.speaker: First Soldier

lines.value: See, they have shut him in.
lines.speaker: First Soldier

lines.value: All
lines.speaker: All

lines.value: To the pot, I warrant him.
lines.speaker: All

lines.value: LARTIUS
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: What is become of Marcius?
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: All
lines.speaker: All

lines.value: Slain, sir, doubtless.
lines.speaker: All

lines.value: First Soldier
lines.speaker: First Soldier

lines.value: Following the fliers at the very heels,
lines.speaker: First Soldier

lines.value: With them he enters; who, upon the sudden,
lines.speaker: First Soldier

lines.value: Clapp'd to their gates: he is himself alone,
lines.speaker: First Soldier

lines.value: To answer all the city.
lines.speaker: First Soldier

lines.value: LARTIUS
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: O noble fellow!
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: Who sensibly outdares his senseless sword,
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: And, when it bows, stands up. Thou art left, Marcius:
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: A carbuncle entire, as big as thou art,
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: Were not so rich a jewel. Thou wast a soldier
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: Even to Cato's wish, not fierce and terrible
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: Only in strokes; but, with thy grim looks and
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: The thunder-like percussion of thy sounds,
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: Thou madst thine enemies shake, as if the world
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: Were feverous and did tremble.
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: First Soldier
lines.speaker: First Soldier

lines.value: Look, sir.
lines.speaker: First Soldier

lines.value: LARTIUS
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: O,'tis Marcius!
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: Let's fetch him off, or make remain alike.
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: First Roman
lines.speaker: First Roman

lines.value: This will I carry to Rome.
lines.speaker: First Roman

lines.value: Second Roman
lines.speaker: Second Roman

lines.value: And I this.
lines.speaker: Second Roman

lines.value: Third Roman
lines.speaker: Third Roman

lines.value: A murrain on't! I took this for silver.
lines.speaker: Third Roman

lines.value: MARCIUS
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: See here these movers that do prize their hours
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: At a crack'd drachm! Cushions, leaden spoons,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Irons of a doit, doublets that hangmen would
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Bury with those that wore them, these base slaves,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Ere yet the fight be done, pack up: down with them!
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: And hark, what noise the general makes! To him!
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: There is the man of my soul's hate, Aufidius,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Piercing our Romans: then, valiant Titus, take
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Convenient numbers to make good the city;
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Whilst I, with those that have the spirit, will haste
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: To help Cominius.
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: LARTIUS
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: Worthy sir, thou bleed'st;
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: Thy exercise hath been too violent for
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: A second course of fight.
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: MARCIUS
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Sir, praise me not;
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: My work hath yet not warm'd me: fare you well:
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: The blood I drop is rather physical
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Than dangerous to me: to Aufidius thus
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: I will appear, and fight.
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: LARTIUS
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: Now the fair goddess, Fortune,
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: Fall deep in love with thee; and her great charms
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: Misguide thy opposers' swords! Bold gentleman,
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: Prosperity be thy page!
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: MARCIUS
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Thy friend no less
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Than those she placeth highest! So, farewell.
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: LARTIUS
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: Thou worthiest Marcius!
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: Go, sound thy trumpet in the market-place;
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: Call thither all the officers o' the town,
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: Where they shall know our mind: away!
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: COMINIUS
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Breathe you, my friends: well fought;
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: we are come off
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Like Romans, neither foolish in our stands,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Nor cowardly in retire: believe me, sirs,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: We shall be charged again. Whiles we have struck,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: By interims and conveying gusts we have heard
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: The charges of our friends. Ye Roman gods!
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Lead their successes as we wish our own,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: That both our powers, with smiling
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: fronts encountering,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: May give you thankful sacrifice.
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Thy news?
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Messenger
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: The citizens of Corioli have issued,
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: And given to Lartius and to Marcius battle:
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: I saw our party to their trenches driven,
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: And then I came away.
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: COMINIUS
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Though thou speak'st truth,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Methinks thou speak'st not well.
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: How long is't since?
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Messenger
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: Above an hour, my lord.
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: COMINIUS
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: 'Tis not a mile; briefly we heard their drums:
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: How couldst thou in a mile confound an hour,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: And bring thy news so late?
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Messenger
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: Spies of the Volsces
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: Held me in chase, that I was forced to wheel
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: Three or four miles about, else had I, sir,
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: Half an hour since brought my report.
lines.speaker: Messenger

lines.value: COMINIUS
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Who's yonder,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: That does appear as he were flay'd? O gods
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: He has the stamp of Marcius; and I have
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Before-time seen him thus.
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: MARCIUS
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: [Within]                 Come I too late?
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: COMINIUS
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: The shepherd knows not thunder from a tabour
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: More than I know the sound of Marcius' tongue
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: From every meaner man.
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: MARCIUS
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Come I too late?
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: COMINIUS
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Ay, if you come not in the blood of others,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: But mantled in your own.
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: MARCIUS
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: O, let me clip ye
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: In arms as sound as when I woo'd, in heart
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: As merry as when our nuptial day was done,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: And tapers burn'd to bedward!
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: COMINIUS
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Flower of warriors,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: How is it with Titus Lartius?
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: MARCIUS
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: As with a man busied about decrees:
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Condemning some to death, and some to exile;
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Ransoming him, or pitying, threatening the other;
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Holding Corioli in the name of Rome,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Even like a fawning greyhound in the leash,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: To let him slip at will.
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: COMINIUS
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Where is that slave
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Which told me they had beat you to your trenches?
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Where is he? call him hither.
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: MARCIUS
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Let him alone;
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: He did inform the truth: but for our gentlemen,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: The common file--a plague! tribunes for them!--
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: The mouse ne'er shunn'd the cat as they did budge
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: From rascals worse than they.
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: COMINIUS
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: But how prevail'd you?
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: MARCIUS
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Will the time serve to tell? I do not think.
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Where is the enemy? are you lords o' the field?
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: If not, why cease you till you are so?
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: COMINIUS
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Marcius,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: We have at disadvantage fought and did
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Retire to win our purpose.
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: MARCIUS
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: How lies their battle? know you on which side
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: They have placed their men of trust?
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: COMINIUS
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: As I guess, Marcius,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Their bands i' the vaward are the Antiates,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Of their best trust; o'er them Aufidius,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Their very heart of hope.
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: MARCIUS
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: I do beseech you,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: By all the battles wherein we have fought,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: By the blood we have shed together, by the vows
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: We have made to endure friends, that you directly
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Set me against Aufidius and his Antiates;
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: And that you not delay the present, but,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Filling the air with swords advanced and darts,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: We prove this very hour.
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: COMINIUS
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Though I could wish
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: You were conducted to a gentle bath
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: And balms applied to, you, yet dare I never
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Deny your asking: take your choice of those
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: That best can aid your action.
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: MARCIUS
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Those are they
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: That most are willing. If any such be here--
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: As it were sin to doubt--that love this painting
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Wherein you see me smear'd; if any fear
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Lesser his person than an ill report;
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: If any think brave death outweighs bad life
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: And that his country's dearer than himself;
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Let him alone, or so many so minded,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Wave thus, to express his disposition,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: And follow Marcius.
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: O, me alone! make you a sword of me?
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: If these shows be not outward, which of you
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: But is four Volsces? none of you but is
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Able to bear against the great Aufidius
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: A shield as hard as his. A certain number,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Though thanks to all, must I select
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: from all: the rest
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Shall bear the business in some other fight,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: As cause will be obey'd. Please you to march;
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: And four shall quickly draw out my command,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Which men are best inclined.
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: COMINIUS
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: March on, my fellows:
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Make good this ostentation, and you shall
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Divide in all with us.
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: LARTIUS
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: So, let the ports be guarded: keep your duties,
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: As I have set them down. If I do send, dispatch
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: Those centuries to our aid: the rest will serve
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: For a short holding: if we lose the field,
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: We cannot keep the town.
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: Lieutenant
lines.speaker: Lieutenant

lines.value: Fear not our care, sir.
lines.speaker: Lieutenant

lines.value: LARTIUS
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: Hence, and shut your gates upon's.
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: Our guider, come; to the Roman camp conduct us.
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: MARCIUS
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: I'll fight with none but thee; for I do hate thee
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Worse than a promise-breaker.
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: AUFIDIUS
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: We hate alike:
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Not Afric owns a serpent I abhor
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: More than thy fame and envy. Fix thy foot.
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: MARCIUS
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Let the first budger die the other's slave,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: And the gods doom him after!
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: AUFIDIUS
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: If I fly, Marcius,
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Holloa me like a hare.
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: MARCIUS
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Within these three hours, Tullus,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Alone I fought in your Corioli walls,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: And made what work I pleased: 'tis not my blood
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Wherein thou seest me mask'd; for thy revenge
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Wrench up thy power to the highest.
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: AUFIDIUS
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Wert thou the Hector
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: That was the whip of your bragg'd progeny,
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Thou shouldst not scape me here.
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Officious, and not valiant, you have shamed me
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: In your condemned seconds.
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: COMINIUS
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: If I should tell thee o'er this thy day's work,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Thou'ldst not believe thy deeds: but I'll report it
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Where senators shall mingle tears with smiles,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Where great patricians shall attend and shrug,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: I' the end admire, where ladies shall be frighted,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: And, gladly quaked, hear more; where the
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: dull tribunes,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: That, with the fusty plebeians, hate thine honours,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Shall say against their hearts 'We thank the gods
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Our Rome hath such a soldier.'
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Yet camest thou to a morsel of this feast,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Having fully dined before.
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: LARTIUS
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: O general,
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: Here is the steed, we the caparison:
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: Hadst thou beheld--
lines.speaker: LARTIUS

lines.value: MARCIUS
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Pray now, no more: my mother,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Who has a charter to extol her blood,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: When she does praise me grieves me. I have done
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: As you have done; that's what I can; induced
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: As you have been; that's for my country:
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: He that has but effected his good will
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Hath overta'en mine act.
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: COMINIUS
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: You shall not be
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: The grave of your deserving; Rome must know
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: The value of her own: 'twere a concealment
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Worse than a theft, no less than a traducement,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: To hide your doings; and to silence that,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Which, to the spire and top of praises vouch'd,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Would seem but modest: therefore, I beseech you
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: In sign of what you are, not to reward
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: What you have done--before our army hear me.
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: MARCIUS
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: I have some wounds upon me, and they smart
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: To hear themselves remember'd.
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: COMINIUS
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Should they not,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Well might they fester 'gainst ingratitude,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: And tent themselves with death. Of all the horses,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Whereof we have ta'en good and good store, of all
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: The treasure in this field achieved and city,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: We render you the tenth, to be ta'en forth,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Before the common distribution, at
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Your only choice.
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: MARCIUS
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: I thank you, general;
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: But cannot make my heart consent to take
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: A bribe to pay my sword: I do refuse it;
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: And stand upon my common part with those
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: That have beheld the doing.
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: MARCIUS
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: May these same instruments, which you profane,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Never sound more! when drums and trumpets shall
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: I' the field prove flatterers, let courts and cities be
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Made all of false-faced soothing!
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: When steel grows soft as the parasite's silk,
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Let him be made a coverture for the wars!
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: No more, I say! For that I have not wash'd
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: My nose that bled, or foil'd some debile wretch.--
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: Which, without note, here's many else have done,--
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: You shout me forth
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: In acclamations hyperbolical;
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: As if I loved my little should be dieted
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: In praises sauced with lies.
lines.speaker: MARCIUS

lines.value: COMINIUS
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Too modest are you;
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: More cruel to your good report than grateful
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: To us that give you truly: by your patience,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Could you not have told him

lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I' the body of the weal; and now, arriving
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: A place of potency and sway o' the state,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: If he should still malignantly remain
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Fast foe to the plebeii, your voices might
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Be curses to yourselves? You should have said
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: That as his worthy deeds did claim no less
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Than what he stood for, so his gracious nature
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Would think upon you for your voices and
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Translate his malice towards you into love,
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: Standing your friendly lord.

lines.value: SICINIUS

lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: Either his gracious promise, which you might,
lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: As cause had call'd you up, have held him to
lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: Which easily endures not article
lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: Tying him to aught; so putting him to rage,
lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: With what contempt he wore the humble weed,
lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: MENENIUS

lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Scratches with briers,

lines.value: MENENIUS
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: That when he speaks not like a citizen,
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: You find him like a soldier: do not take
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: His rougher accents for malicious sounds,
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: But, as I say, such as become a soldier,
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: Rather than envy you.

lines.value: COMINIUS

lines.value: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: SICINIUS
lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: Yourself into a power tyrannical;

lines.value: CORIOLANUS
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: How! traitor!

lines.value: MENENIUS
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: Nay, temperately; your promise.

lines.value: CORIOLANUS
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: The fires i' the lowest hell fold-in the people!

lines.value: Call me their traitor! Thou injurious tribune!
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Within thine eyes sat twenty thousand deaths,
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: In thy hand clutch'd as many millions, in
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Thy lying tongue both numbers, I would say

lines.value: 'Thou liest' unto thee with a voice as free
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: SICINIUS

lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: So criminal and in such capital kind,

lines.value: BRUTUS
lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: I talk of that, that know it.

lines.value: CORIOLANUS
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: You?

lines.value: MENENIUS

lines.value: CORIOLANUS
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Let them pronounce the steep Tarpeian death,
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Vagabond exile, raying, pent to linger
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Their mercy at the price of one fair word;
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Nor cheque my courage for what they can give,
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: To have't with saying 'Good morrow.'
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: SICINIUS
lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: For that he has,
lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: As much as in him lies, from time to time
lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: Envied against the people, seeking means
lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: To pluck away their power, as now at last
lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: Given hostile strokes, and that not in the presence
lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: Of dreaded justice, but on the ministers
lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: That do distribute it; in the name o' the people
lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: And in the power of us the tribunes, we,
lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: Even from this instant, banish him our city,
lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: In peril of precipitation
lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: From off the rock Tarpeian never more
lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: To enter our Rome gates: i' the people's name,
lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: I say it shall be so.

lines.value: Citizens

lines.value: It shall be so, it shall be so; let him away:

lines.value: COMINIUS
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: Her enemies' marks upon me. I do love

lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: More holy and profound, than mine own life,
lines.speaker: COMINIUS

lines.value: SICINIUS
lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: There's no more to be said, but he is banish'd,

lines.speaker: BRUTUS

lines.value: It shall be so.

lines.value: Citizens

lines.value: It shall be so, it shall be so.

lines.value: CORIOLANUS
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: You common cry of curs! whose breath I hate
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: As reek o' the rotten fens, whose loves I prize
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: As the dead carcasses of unburied men
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: That do corrupt my air, I banish you;
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: And here remain with your uncertainty!
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Let every feeble rumour shake your hearts!
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Your enemies, with nodding of their plumes,
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Fan you into despair! Have the power still
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: To banish your defenders; till at length
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Your ignorance, which finds not till it feels,
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Making not reservation of yourselves,
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Still your own foes, deliver you as most
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: That won you without blows! Despising,
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: For you, the city, thus I turn my back:

lines.value: There is a world elsewhere.

lines.value: CORIOLANUS
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: With many heads butts me away. Nay, mother,

lines.value: To say extremity was the trier of spirits;
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: That common chances common men could bear;
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: When most struck home, being gentle wounded, craves
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: With precepts that would make invincible
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: I'll do well yet. Thou old and true Menenius,

lines.value: Thy tears are salter than a younger man's,

lines.value: And venomous to thine eyes. My sometime general,

lines.value: I have seen thee stem, and thou hast oft beheld
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Heart-hardening spectacles; tell these sad women

lines.value: 'Tis fond to wail inevitable strokes,
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: As 'tis to laugh at 'em. My mother, you wot well
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: My hazards still have been your solace: and
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Believe't not lightly--though I go alone,
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Like to a lonely dragon, that his fen
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Makes fear'd and talk'd of more than seen--your son
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Will or exceed the common or be caught
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: With cautelous baits and practise.

lines.value: VOLUMNIA
lines.speaker: VOLUMNIA

lines.value: My first son.

lines.value: With thee awhile: determine on some course,

lines.value: More than a wild exposture to each chance

lines.value: That starts i' the way before thee.

lines.value: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: I' the absence of the needer.

lines.value: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Come, my sweet wife, my dearest mother, and

lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: That's worthily

lines.value: As any ear can hear. Come, let's not weep.

lines.value: From these old arms and legs, by the good gods,

lines.value: O world, thy slippery turns! Friends now fast sworn,
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Unseparable, shall within this hour,

lines.value: Permitted by our dastard nobles, who

lines.value: To be full quit of those my banishers,

lines.value: Of shame seen through thy country, speed

lines.value: thee straight,

lines.value: And make my misery serve thy turn: so use it

lines.value: That my revengeful services may prove

lines.value: Against my canker'd country with the spleen

lines.value: Of all the under fiends. But if so be

lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Or rudely visit them in parts remote,
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: To fright them, ere destroy. But come in:
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Let me commend thee first to those that shall
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Say yea to thy desires. A thousand welcomes!
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: And more a friend than e'er an enemy;
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Yet, Marcius, that was much. Your hand: most welcome!
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: First Servingman
lines.speaker: First Servingman

lines.speaker: Second Servingman

lines.speaker: Second Servingman

lines.value: First Servingman
lines.speaker: First Servingman

lines.value: He had so; looking as it were--would I were hanged,
lines.speaker: First Servingman

lines.speaker: First Servingman

lines.speaker: Second Servingman

lines.speaker: Second Servingman

lines.value: man i' the world.
lines.speaker: Second Servingman

lines.value: First Servingman
lines.speaker: First Servingman

lines.value: I think he is: but a greater soldier than he you wot on.

lines.value: Second Servingman
lines.speaker: Second Servingman

lines.speaker: Second Servingman

lines.value: First Servingman
lines.speaker: First Servingman

lines.value: Second Servingman
lines.speaker: Second Servingman

lines.value: Worth six on him.

lines.speaker: First Servingman

lines.value: Faith, look you, one cannot tell how to say that:

lines.speaker: First Servingman

lines.speaker: Third Servingman

lines.speaker: Third Servingman

lines.value: the middle and but one half of what he was

lines.value: Third Servingman
lines.speaker: Third Servingman

lines.value: Second Servingman
lines.speaker: Second Servingman

lines.value: Why, then we shall have a stirring world again.
lines.speaker: Second Servingman

lines.value: This peace is nothing, but to rust iron, increase
lines.speaker: Second Servingman

lines.value: tailors, and breed ballad-makers.
lines.speaker: Second Servingman

lines.value: First Servingman
lines.speaker: First Servingman

lines.value: Let me have war, say I; it exceeds peace as far as
lines.speaker: First Servingman

lines.value: day does night; it's spritely, waking, audible, and
lines.speaker: First Servingman

lines.value: full of vent. Peace is a very apoplexy, lethargy;
lines.speaker: First Servingman

lines.value: mulled, deaf, sleepy, insensible; a getter of more
lines.speaker: First Servingman

lines.value: bastard children than war's a destroyer of men.
lines.speaker: First Servingman

lines.value: Second Servingman
lines.speaker: Second Servingman

lines.value: 'Tis so: and as war, in some sort, may be said to
lines.speaker: Second Servingman

lines.speaker: Second Servingman

lines.value: great maker of cuckolds.
lines.speaker: Second Servingman

lines.value: First Servingman
lines.speaker: First Servingman

lines.value: Ay, and it makes men hate one another.
lines.speaker: First Servingman

lines.speaker: Third Servingman

lines.value: Their talk at table, and their thanks at end;
lines.speaker: Lieutenant

lines.value: Even by your own.

lines.value: AUFIDIUS
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Of our design. He bears himself more proudlier,

lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: When first I did embrace him: yet his nature
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: In that's no changeling; and I must excuse
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: What cannot be amended.
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Lieutenant
lines.speaker: Lieutenant

lines.value: Yet I wish, sir,--
lines.speaker: Lieutenant

lines.value: I mean for your particular,--you had not
lines.speaker: Lieutenant

lines.value: Join'd in commission with him; but either
lines.speaker: Lieutenant

lines.value: Had borne the action of yourself, or else
lines.speaker: Lieutenant

lines.value: To him had left it solely.
lines.speaker: Lieutenant

lines.value: AUFIDIUS
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: I understand thee well; and be thou sure,
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: when he shall come to his account, he knows not
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: What I can urge against him. Although it seems,
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: And so he thinks, and is no less apparent
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: To the vulgar eye, that he bears all things fairly.
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: And shows good husbandry for the Volscian state,
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Fights dragon-like, and does achieve as soon
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: As draw his sword; yet he hath left undone
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: That which shall break his neck or hazard mine,
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Whene'er we come to our account.
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Lieutenant
lines.speaker: Lieutenant

lines.value: Sir, I beseech you, think you he'll carry Rome?
lines.speaker: Lieutenant

lines.value: AUFIDIUS
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: All places yield to him ere he sits down;
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: And the nobility of Rome are his:
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: The senators and patricians love him too:
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: The tribunes are no soldiers; and their people
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Will be as rash in the repeal, as hasty
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: To expel him thence. I think he'll be to Rome
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: As is the osprey to the fish, who takes it
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: By sovereignty of nature. First he was
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: A noble servant to them; but he could not
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Carry his honours even: whether 'twas pride,
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Which out of daily fortune ever taints
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: The happy man; whether defect of judgment,
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: To fail in the disposing of those chances
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Which he was lord of; or whether nature,
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Not to be other than one thing, not moving
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: From the casque to the cushion, but commanding peace
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Even with the same austerity and garb
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: As he controll'd the war; but one of these--
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: As he hath spices of them all, not all,
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: For I dare so far free him--made him fear'd,
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: So hated, and so banish'd: but he has a merit,
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: To choke it in the utterance. So our virtues
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Lie in the interpretation of the time:
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: And power, unto itself most commendable,
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Hath not a tomb so evident as a chair
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: To extol what it hath done.
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: One fire drives out one fire; one nail, one nail;
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Rights by rights falter, strengths by strengths do fail.
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Come, let's away. When, Caius, Rome is thine,
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Thou art poor'st of all; then shortly art thou mine.

lines.value: O mother, mother!
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: What have you done? Behold, the heavens do ope,
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: The gods look down, and this unnatural scene
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: They laugh at. O my mother, mother! O!
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: You have won a happy victory to Rome;
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: But, for your son,--believe it, O, believe it,
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Most dangerously you have with him prevail'd,
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: If not most mortal to him. But, let it come.
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Aufidius, though I cannot make true wars,
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: I'll frame convenient peace. Now, good Aufidius,
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Were you in my stead, would you have heard
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: A mother less? or granted less, Aufidius?
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: AUFIDIUS
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: I was moved withal.
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: CORIOLANUS
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: I dare be sworn you were:
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: And, sir, it is no little thing to make
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Mine eyes to sweat compassion. But, good sir,
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: What peace you'll make, advise me: for my part,
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: I'll not to Rome, I'll back with you; and pray you,
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Stand to me in this cause. O mother! wife!
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: AUFIDIUS
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: [Aside]  I am glad thou hast set thy mercy and
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: thy honour
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: At difference in thee: out of that I'll work
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Myself a former fortune.
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: CORIOLANUS
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Ay, by and by;
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: But we will drink together; and you shall bear
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: A better witness back than words, which we,
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: On like conditions, will have counter-seal'd.
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Come, enter with us. Ladies, you deserve
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: To have a temple built you: all the swords
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: In Italy, and her confederate arms,
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: Could not have made this peace.
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: condition of a man!

lines.value: MENENIUS
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: There is differency between a grub and a butterfly;
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: from man to dragon: he has wings; he's more than a
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: creeping thing.
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: SICINIUS
lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: He loved his mother dearly.
lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: MENENIUS
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: So did he me: and he no more remembers his mother
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: now than an eight-year-old horse. The tartness
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: of his face sours ripe grapes: when he walks, he
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: moves like an engine, and the ground shrinks before
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: his treading: he is able to pierce a corslet with
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: his eye; talks like a knell, and his hum is a
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: battery. He sits in his state, as a thing made for
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: Alexander. What he bids be done is finished with
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: his bidding. He wants nothing of a god but eternity
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: and a heaven to throne in.
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: SICINIUS
lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: MENENIUS
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: mother shall bring from him: there is no more mercy
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: in him than there is milk in a male tiger; that
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: shall our poor city find: and all this is long of
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: you.
lines.speaker: MENENIUS

lines.value: SICINIUS

lines.speaker: SICINIUS

lines.value: Second Lord
lines.speaker: Second Lord

lines.value: Peace, ho! no outrage: peace!
lines.speaker: Second Lord

lines.value: The man is noble and his fame folds-in
lines.speaker: Second Lord

lines.value: This orb o' the earth. His last offences to us
lines.speaker: Second Lord

lines.value: Shall have judicious hearing. Stand, Aufidius,
lines.speaker: Second Lord

lines.value: And trouble not the peace.
lines.speaker: Second Lord

lines.value: CORIOLANUS
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: O that I had him,
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: With six Aufidiuses, or more, his tribe,
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: To use my lawful sword!
lines.speaker: CORIOLANUS

lines.value: AUFIDIUS
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Insolent villain!
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: All Conspirators
lines.speaker: All Conspirators

lines.value: Kill, kill, kill, kill, kill him!
lines.speaker: All Conspirators

lines.value: Lords
lines.speaker: Lords

lines.value: Hold, hold, hold, hold!
lines.speaker: Lords

lines.value: AUFIDIUS
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: My noble masters, hear me speak.
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: First Lord
lines.speaker: First Lord

lines.value: O Tullus,--
lines.speaker: First Lord

lines.value: Second Lord
lines.speaker: Second Lord

lines.value: Thou hast done a deed whereat valour will weep.
lines.speaker: Second Lord

lines.value: Third Lord
lines.speaker: Third Lord

lines.value: Tread not upon him. Masters all, be quiet;
lines.speaker: Third Lord

lines.value: Put up your swords.
lines.speaker: Third Lord

lines.value: AUFIDIUS
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: My lords, when you shall know--as in this rage,
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Provoked by him, you cannot--the great danger
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Which this man's life did owe you, you'll rejoice
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: That he is thus cut off. Please it your honours
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: To call me to your senate, I'll deliver
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Myself your loyal servant, or endure
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Your heaviest censure.
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: First Lord
lines.speaker: First Lord

lines.value: Bear from hence his body;
lines.speaker: First Lord

lines.value: And mourn you for him: let him be regarded
lines.speaker: First Lord

lines.value: As the most noble corse that ever herald
lines.speaker: First Lord

lines.value: Did follow to his urn.
lines.speaker: First Lord

lines.value: Second Lord
lines.speaker: Second Lord

lines.value: His own impatience
lines.speaker: Second Lord

lines.value: Takes from Aufidius a great part of blame.
lines.speaker: Second Lord

lines.value: Let's make the best of it.
lines.speaker: Second Lord

lines.value: AUFIDIUS
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: My rage is gone;
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: And I am struck with sorrow. Take him up.
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Help, three o' the chiefest soldiers; I'll be one.
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Beat thou the drum, that it speak mournfully:
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Trail your steel pikes. Though in this city he
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Hath widow'd and unchilded many a one,
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Which to this hour bewail the injury,
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS

lines.value: Yet he shall have a noble memory. Assist.
lines.speaker: AUFIDIUS
